abstract.p: Asks JSH to make contact with Joseph Jukes, ahead of his 1842 expedition to New Guinea, the Torres Straits and Australia, in order to increase his understanding of botany.

revisionDesc.change: Converted to XML by Huw Jones
Converted to TEI P5 by Michael Hawkins

div.p: Jukes who I dare say you remember at all events by name who has been out to survey Newfoundland & is not long since returned is going out with Capt Blackwood on a surveying expedition to New Guinea & the straits between that island and Australia.

I am sure you will do all in your power to give him all kinds of hints & information that may be useful to him – He is going almost immediately & knows little or nothing of botany – a great pity but one which under your direction he may try & do something to remedy by knowing what to get and how to get it.
Will you put yourself in communication with him? His present address is 1 Pauls Terrace Wolverhampton
